title: Airbnb shares drop 14% on earnings miss as company warns of slowing U.S. demand
content: Airbnb shares dropped 14% in after-hours trading after the company reported second-quarter earnings that missed analyst expectations.
summary: Airbnb shares dropped 14% in after-hours trading after the company reported second-quarter earnings that missed analyst expectations.

content: Kamala Harris and Tim Walz are up against the Republican ticket of Donald Trump and JD Vance.

title: Super Micro announces 10-for-1 stock split, shares plunge 13% on earnings miss
content: Super Micro announced a 10-for-1 stock split and issued upbeat guidance for the first quarter.
summary: Super Micro announced a 10-for-1 stock split and issued upbeat guidance for the first quarter.

title: The popular 'carry trade' is unwinding — and economists fear Fed rate cuts could make matters worse
content: The warning comes as market participants seek to aggressively roll back on carry trades following a dramatic global sell-off in risk assets.
summary: The warning comes as market participants seek to aggressively roll back on carry trades following a dramatic global sell-off in risk assets.

title: Rivian tops Wall Street's second-quarter expectations amid cost cuts
content: Rivian beat Wall Street's top- and bottom-line expectations for the second quarter as the electric vehicle maker continues to take costs out of its business.

title: Trump, Harris campaigns race to define Democratic running mate Tim Walz
content: The Kamala Harris and Donald Trump presidential campaigns pushed dueling portraits of Harris' newly announced Democratic running mate, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz.

title: Microsoft fires back at Delta after massive outage, says airline declined 'repeated' offers for help
content: Microsoft said Delta turned down several offers for help during the flight disruptions following the outage.

title: Trump possible target of Pakistani national charged in murder-for-hire plot
content: Asif Merchant was arrested in the murder-for-hire case a day before a gunman narrowly missed killing Donald Trump at a campaign rally in Pennsylvania.

title: As riots and disorder spread, some countries warn their citizens about traveling to the UK
content: Five countries have issued travel and safety warnings to their citizens living or visiting the U.K. as riots and street disorder continue to plague the country.

title: China launches its rival to Elon Musk's Starlink internet satellites
content: By 2025, China is aiming to deploy 648 satellites of the "Thousand Sails Constellation" to create global internet coverage, according to state media CCTV.
summary: By 2025, China is aiming to deploy 648 satellites of the "Thousand Sails Constellation" to create global internet coverage, according to state media CCTV.

title: Biggest concern is the market sell-off becoming a 'self-fulfilling prophecy,' research firm warns
content: The global stock market sell-off of recent days could be a "self-fulfilling prophecy" and eventually lead to a recession, Morningstar DBRS analysts warned.
summary: The global stock market sell-off of recent days could be a "self-fulfilling prophecy" and eventually lead to a recession, Morningstar DBRS analysts warned.

title: Ukraine finally sends F-16s into the battle against Russia — but they might not be a game-changer
content: It was a pivotal moment for Ukraine as it unveiled its first F-16 fighter jets on Sunday. The difference the aircraft will make in battle remains to be seen.
summary: It was a pivotal moment for Ukraine as it unveiled its first F-16 fighter jets on Sunday. The difference the aircraft will make in battle remains to be seen.

title: Correction in the dollar-yen was overdue and may be 'healthy' for markets, former ECB chief says
content: "Everybody knew that the yen was not in an appropriate position," Jean-Claude Trichet told CNBC.

title: Japan's Nikkei sees best day since October 2008; logs record single-day jump in points

title: Oil giant Saudi Aramco's second-quarter profit dips 3% on lower crude production volumes
content: Saudi Aramco reported $29.1 billion in net profit for the second quarter, a dip of 3% from the same period last year as production volumes remained low.

title: UNESCO uses emergency procedure to name Gaza site to both its ‘World Heritage’ and ‘In Danger’ lists

title: $1 trillion wipeout: Market rout punishes megacap tech

title: San Francisco Fed President Daly sees interest rate cuts coming as labor market weakens
content: Progress on inflation and a clear slowdown in hiring likely will drive the Fed to some extent of policy easing, Daly said Monday.
summary: Progress on inflation and a clear slowdown in hiring likely will drive the Fed to some extent of policy easing, Daly said Monday.

title: OpenAI co-founder John Schulman says he will leave and join rival Anthropic

title: Google loses antitrust case over search

title: Investors are unwinding the biggest ‘carry trade’ the world has ever seen, SocGen strategist says
content: Carry trades refer to trades wherein an investor borrows in a currency with low interest rates and reinvests the proceeds in higher-yielding assets elsewhere.
summary: Carry trades refer to trades wherein an investor borrows in a currency with low interest rates and reinvests the proceeds in higher-yielding assets elsewhere.
